abstract: A lot less than you might think, a study shows.
snippet: A lot less than you might think, a study shows.
lead_paragraph: Becoming a mother changes everything, right? Maybe not. A post over on Nate Silver's FiveThirtyEight blog takes a look at what effect becoming a mother has on support for the legalization of marijuana. According to research by Jill Greenlee, a political scientist at Brandeis University, the answer is not very much. Read more at FiveThirtyEight, then come back here and let us know what you think. Has having kids changed your views on drug use or legalization? If you experimented with drugs when you were younger, do you plan on telling your children about it?

headline.main: Does Motherhood Change Views on Drugs?
